p: The remaining items (n = 79) were assessed for depth of exploration of topic, where items that did not explore the interaction of at least two of the three themes of climate change, food security and health were excluded (for example, if an item only spoke about ‘climate change’ from a purely atmospheric science perspective, it was deemed not eligible). An additional 49 items were excluded at this stage. It is notable that no articles expressing doubt on links between food security problems and climate change were found during this process.
